page.title: 18Ecology In Clarkes Gardens
page.content: Clarkes Gardens is in Allerton, Liverpool. It has its own{gardening} depot that was built in 1659. A plaque shows the initials "R L K" standing for Richard Latham Katharine. The park is ideal for a picnic or for walking your dog. Part of the gardens has been specially designed to attract butterflies, rabbits, birds and other {wildlife.}In addition, there is a little{farm}where sheep, bees, hens and birds are kept. They have 2 kinds of{sheep,}Jacob and Soay and 2 hives containing 40,000{bees.}The{hives}are of particular interest, bearing the initials of the man who invented this kind of hive, William Gee Card. There are some interesting birds and{ducks} including the Khaki Campbell duck which has 5 toes, Guinea Fowl, Silver Spangled Hamburgh and Light Sussex. GILLIAN RAMAGE and SALLY HEMS.
